alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Rainfall, combined with melting snow, continues. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall.

What:
Rainfall totals of 15 to 25 mm.

When:
Continuing early this morning.

Additional information:
Rain associated with a low pressure system will continue to bring rain to the northeastern shores of Lake Superior this morning. Rainfall amounts will likely be highly variable, with some areas potentially receiving up to 25 mm. Thunderstorms area possible as well.

Localized flooding in low-lying areas and water pooling on roads are possible.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Rainfall, combined with melting snow, will move into the area early this morning. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall.

What:
Rainfall totals of 15 to 25 mm.

When:
Continuing into early this afternoon.

Additional information:
Rain associated with a low pressure system will continue to bring rain to parts of northeastern Ontario through early this afternoon. Rainfall amounts will likely be highly variable, with some areas potentially receiving up to 25 mm.

Localized flooding in low-lying areas and water pooling on roads are possible.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Potential for heavy rainfall and thunderstorms today and tonight. 

What:
Localized rainfall amounts up to 50 mm.

When:
First round of showers this morning into the early afternoon. Second, more substantial round of showers and thunderstorms tonight.

Additional information:
Numerous showers and thunderstorms associated with a warm front are expected to affect portions of the area. Areas that are affected by several thunderstorms may receive as much as 50 mm of rain. Rainfall warnings may be required.

Localized flooding in low-lying areas and water pooling on roads are possible.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

affected_areas.area_description: Town of Parry Sound - Rosseau - Killbear Park

Fenelon Falls - Balsam Lake Park - Northern Kawartha Lakes

alerts.headline: fog advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring.

Patches of dense fog will dissipate this evening.

###

Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.
